intro: Palicourea oreadium, commonly known as the mountain beauty or rock beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
